oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Briscoe. Marine Barracks in D.C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: W. Russell Briscoe
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: W.R. (William Russell) Briscoe (1899-1979) ink sketch of military life as a Marine during World War I (WWI). 'Morning Colors U.S. Marine Barracks, Washington, D.C.' Signed W. R. Briscoe [19]19. For most of his life, Russell Briscoe lived and worked in Knoxville, TN. He joined the Marines during World War I and was stationed in Washington, D.C. He was co-owner with his wife of Bristoy toy company in the 1930s and he was an executive vice president of the J.E. Lutz Insurance Company. He began painting at age 57 and produced 75 painting, most of historic subjects in East Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drawings; Military life; Cartoons (Working drawings); Flags; Flagpoles;
